summary.long: Proverbs is a book of the Old Testament.

verses.text: The proverbs of Solomon, son of David, king of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
To learn wisdom and discipline,
to understand sayings that give insight,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
to acquire discipline to act sensibly,
to acquire righteousness, justice, and fairness,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
to give good judgment to the inexperienced,
to give a young man knowledge and foresight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A wise person should listen, and he will increase learning.
A person with understanding should obtain guidance
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
so he will understand proverbs, puzzling statements,
and the thought-provoking words of the wise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The fear of the Lord is the beginning of knowledge,
but stubborn fools despise wisdom and discipline.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Listen, my son, to your father’s discipline,
and do not forsake your mother’s teaching,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
because they are a garland of grace for your head.
They are jewelry for your neck.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My son, if sinners lure you,
do not go along with them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If they say,
“Come with us.
Let’s lie in wait to shed blood.
Let’s hide and ambush an innocent person for no reason.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
We will swallow them alive like the grave.
We will swallow them whole
    like those who go down to the pit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
We will find all kinds of wealth and treasure.
    We will fill our houses with loot.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Cast your lot with us.
    We will all share one bag of money.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My son, do not walk along the road with them.
Do not set foot on their path,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
because their feet run to do evil,
    and they hurry to shed blood.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: How useless to spread a net in the sight of any bird!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yet they set up an ambush for their own blood.
They hide in ambush to take their own lives.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This is where the path leads for everyone
    who is greedy for stolen property:
It takes away the life of those who possess it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Wisdom calls out loudly in the street.
In the public squares she raises her voice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
At the noisy street corners she calls out.
At the entrances to the city gates she speaks her words:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“How long will you gullible people love being gullible?
How long will scoffers delight in their scoffing?
How long will fools hate knowledge?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If you respond to my warning,
I will pour out my spirit for you.
I will make my words known to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Because I called, but you refused to listen,
because I stretched out my hand, but no one paid attention,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
because you ignored all my advice,
and you did not accept my warning,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
therefore I will laugh at your calamity.
I will jeer when terror strikes you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
when terror strikes you like a violent storm,
when calamity strikes you like a windstorm,
when trouble and distress come upon you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then they will call to me, but I will not answer.
They will look for me, but they will not find me,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
because they hated knowledge,
and they did not choose the fear of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They would not accept my advice,
and they despised all my warnings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So they will eat the fruit of their own way,
and they will be stuffed with their own schemes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore the wandering ways of the gullible kill them,
and the complacency of fools destroys them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But whoever listens to me will live in safety.
He will be secure, without fear of evil.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My son, if you accept my words,
if you store up my commands within you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
by paying attention to wisdom with your ear,
    by reaching out for understanding with your heart,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
if indeed you call out for intelligence,
if you raise your voice for understanding,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
if you search for it like silver,
if you hunt for it like hidden treasure,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
then you will understand the fear of the Lord,
then you will find the knowledge of God,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
because the Lord gives wisdom.
Knowledge and understanding come from his mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He stores up sound judgment for upright people.
He is a shield for those who walk in integrity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He protects those who walk on paths of justice.
He guards the way of his favored ones.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then you will understand righteousness, justice,
    and fairness—every good path,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
because wisdom will come into your heart,
and knowledge will be pleasant for your soul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Foresight will stand guard over you.
Understanding will protect you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It will save you from the evil way,
from the man who speaks perverse things,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
from those who abandon upright paths
    in order to walk in the ways of darkness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It will save you from those who enjoy doing evil,
from those who celebrate the twisted ways of evil,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
from those whose paths are crooked,
and from those whose ways are devious.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Wisdom will save you from the immoral woman,
from the unfaithful woman with her seductive words,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
who abandons the husband of her youth
and forgets the covenant of her God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So she sinks down to death, which becomes her house.
Her way of life leads down to the spirits of the dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
All who enter her house never return.
They never reach the paths of life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This is how to walk in the way of good people,
how to stay on the paths of the righteous.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yes, the upright will live in the land,
and people with integrity will remain in it,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
but wicked people will be cut off from the land,
and treacherous people will be torn out of it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My son, do not forget my teaching.
Let your heart keep my commands,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
because they will add long days and many years to your life,
and peace and prosperity will come to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not allow mercy and truth to leave you.
Fasten them around your neck.
Write them on the tablet of your heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then you will find favor and approval
    in the eyes of God and man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Trust in the Lord with all your heart,
and do not rely on your own understanding.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In all your ways acknowledge him,
and he will make your paths straight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not consider yourself wise.
Fear the Lord, and turn away from evil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then your body will be healed,
and your bones will be refreshed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Honor the Lord with your wealth,
with the firstfruits from your entire harvest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then your barns will be filled to capacity,
and your wine vats will overflow with fresh wine.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not reject the Lord’s discipline, my son,
and do not despise his warning,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
because the Lord warns the one he loves
    as a father warns a son with whom he is pleased.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How blessed is the person who finds wisdom,
the person who acquires understanding,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
because the profit it gives is better than the profit from silver,
and its yield is better than gold!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It is more valuable than gems,
and nothing you desire can equal it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In its right hand are the days of a long life.
In its left hand are riches and honor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Its ways are pleasant ways,
and all its paths are peace.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It is a tree of life for those who hold on to it.
Those who cling to it are blessed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord founded the earth by wisdom.
He established the heavens by understanding.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
By his knowledge the deep waters were divided,
and the clouds drip dew.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My son, do not take your eyes off these things.
Guard sound judgment and insight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They will be life for your soul
and grace to adorn your neck.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then you will walk safely on your way,
and your foot will not stumble.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When you lie down, you will not be afraid.
When you lie down, your sleep will be pleasant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not be afraid of sudden terror,
nor of the destruction of the wicked when it comes,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
because the Lord will be your confidence.
He will keep your foot from being caught.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not withhold good from those to whom it is due
    when it is within your power to give it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not say to your neighbor,
“Go away! Come back some other time.
I will give something to you tomorrow,”
when in fact it is already with you right now.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not plan harm against your neighbor
    when he is living with you peacefully.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not quarrel with a person for no good reason
    when he has done nothing to harm you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not envy a violent person.
Do not choose any of his ways,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
because a crooked person is an abomination to the Lord,
but God’s friendly guidance leads the upright.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord’s curse rests on the house of the wicked,
but he blesses the home of the righteous.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Although he scorns the scornful,
he gives grace to the humble.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Wise people inherit honor,
but proud fools receive disgrace.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Listen, you sons, to a father’s discipline.
Pay attention so that you will gain discernment,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
because I have given you good instruction.
Do not abandon my teaching.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When I was a son living with my father,
a tender and only child with my mother,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
he used to instruct me and say to me,
“Cling to my words with all your heart.
Obey my commands so that you may live.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Acquire wisdom. Acquire understanding.
Do not forget,
and do not turn away from the words of my mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not abandon it, and it will watch over you.
Love it and it will guard you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The beginning of wisdom is to obtain Wisdom.
Give up everything you have, in order to gain Understanding.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Cherish her, and she will exalt you.
She will honor you when you embrace her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
She will set a garland of grace on your head.
She will present you with a beautiful crown.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Listen, my son, and accept my words,
so that the years of your life will be many.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I have instructed you in the way of wisdom.
I have led you along straight paths.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When you walk, your stride will not be hindered.
Even if you run, you will not stumble.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Hold on to discipline. Do not let go.
Guard it, because it is your life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not travel on the path of the wicked.
Do not walk in the way of evil people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Avoid it! Do not travel on it!
Turn away from it. Pass it by.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For they cannot sleep
    unless they have been doing wrong,
and they are robbed of sleep
    unless they are making someone stumble,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
because wickedness is the food they eat,
and violence is the wine they drink.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But the path of the righteous is like the light of dawn,
shining brighter and brighter until it is day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The way of the wicked is like gloomy darkness.
They never know where they will stumble.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My son, pay attention to my words.
Open your ears to what I say.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not let them escape from your sight.
Keep them deep in your heart,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
because they are life for those who find them
and healing for the entire body.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Above all else, guard your heart carefully,
because your life flows from it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Turn your mouth away from perverted speech,
and keep devious lips far away from you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let your eyes look straight ahead.
Let your gaze be directly in front of you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Make a level pathway for your feet,
and all your ways will be secure.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not swerve to the right or the left.
Turn your feet away from evil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My son, pay attention to my wisdom.
Open your ears to my understanding,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
so that you may hold on to insight,
so your lips may guard knowledge,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
because the lips of an immoral woman drip with honey,
and her words are as smooth as olive oil,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
but in the end she is as bitter as wormwood
and as sharp as a double-edged sword.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Her feet go down to death.
Her steps lead to hell.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
She gives no thought to the path of life.
Her ways wander, but she doesn’t realize it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Now, you sons, listen to me.
Do not turn away from the words of my mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Keep your way far from her.
Do not go near the doorway of her house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If you do, you will give your wealth to others
and your years to a cruel person.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If you do, your work will satisfy strangers,
and the results of your labor will end up in another man’s house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You will groan when your end comes,
when your body and flesh are consumed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then you will say, “Oh, how I hated discipline,
and my heart despised warnings!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I did not listen to my teachers’ voices,
and I did not open my ears to hear my instructors.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I soon reached total ruin
in the midst of the assembly of the community.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Drink water from your own cistern.
Drink running water from your own well.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Why should the water from your springs flow out into the street,
your streams of water into the public squares?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They should be yours, yours alone.
They are not for strangers to share with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let your fountain be blessed.
Obtain your joy from the wife you married in your youth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
who is a loving doe and a graceful deer.
Let her breasts satisfy you at all times.
Always be intoxicated with her love.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Why should you be led astray, my son, by an immoral woman?
Why embrace a woman who is not your wife?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the ways of a man are in front of the eyes of the Lord,
and he weighs all of his paths.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The evil deeds of the wicked man will capture him,
and he will be bound by the ropes of his sin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He will die for lack of discipline,
and he will go astray because of his great stupidity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My son, if you have guaranteed your neighbor’s debts,
if you have shaken hands for a stranger,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
you are trapped by the promises from your mouth;
you are captured by the promises from your mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Because you have fallen into your neighbor’s hands,
go, humble yourself, and plead with your neighbor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not allow your eyes to sleep,
or your eyelids to slumber.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Save yourself like a gazelle from the hand of a hunter,
or like a bird from the hand of a trapper.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Go to the ant, you slacker!
Observe its ways and become wise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Although it has no overseer, officer, or ruler,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
it stores its food in summer.
It gathers its provisions at harvest time.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How long will you lie there, you slacker?
When will you get up from your sleep?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A little sleep, a little slumber,
a little folding of your hands to rest,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
and poverty will come on you like a prowler,
and scarcity will come on you like a warrior.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A worthless, wicked scoundrel,
who goes around with a corrupt mouth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
who winks with his eye, signals with his foot,
and gestures with his fingers,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
who plots evil with a deceitful heart—
he always spreads conflict.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore his disaster will come upon him suddenly.
All at once he will be broken, and there will be no remedy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
These are six things the Lord hates,
seven things that really disgust him:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
arrogant eyes, a lying tongue,
hands that shed innocent blood,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
a heart that devises wicked plans,
feet that run quickly to do evil,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
a false witness who breathes lies,
and a person who spreads conflict between brothers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My son, keep your father’s commands,
and do not forsake your mother’s teachings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Fasten them permanently to your heart,
and tie them around your neck.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When you walk around, they will lead you.
When you lie down, they will stand guard over you.
When you wake up, they will converse with you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
because a command is a lamp, teaching is a light,
and the warnings given by discipline are a road to life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They guard you from an evil woman,
from the smooth tongue of a woman who is not your wife.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not desire her beauty in your heart.
Do not let her captivate you with her eyes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A prostitute costs you a loaf of bread,
but a married woman stalks your precious life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Can a man place fire on his lap
    without burning his clothes?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Can a man walk on hot coals
    without scorching his feet?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So it is with the man who goes to his neighbor’s wife.
No one who touches her will be forgiven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
No one despises a thief when he steals
    to satisfy his hunger when he is starving,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
but when he is caught, he will have to repay seven times as much.
He will have to give up all the wealth of his house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whoever commits adultery with a woman lacks sense.
He who does it destroys himself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He will find disease and dishonor,
and his disgrace will never be wiped out,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
because jealousy ignites a husband’s anger,
and he will show no mercy when he takes revenge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He will not accept any amount as a payment.
He will not relent, even if you increase your offer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My son, guard what I say.
Keep my commands with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Obey my commands so that you may live.
Protect my teachings like the pupil of your eye.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Tie them to your fingers.
Write them on the tablet of your heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Say to Wisdom, “You are my sister,”
and call Understanding your relative.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
She will keep you safe from an immoral woman,
from an unfaithful woman and her seductive words.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At a window of my house, I looked out through the lattice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I was watching the gullible people.
Among the young men I noticed a youth without sense.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He was crossing the street near her corner,
strolling along the road to her house,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
in the twilight, in the evening of the day,
when the darkness of the night was coming.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Suddenly a woman meets him.
She is dressed like a prostitute with a scheming heart!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
She is loud and rebellious.
Her feet will not stay home.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
One moment she is in the street.
The next moment she is in the public square.
She is on the prowl near every corner.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
She grabs him and kisses him.
With a brazen face she says,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“I have food from fellowship offerings.
Today I fulfilled my vows.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
That is why I came out to meet you.
I came eagerly to seek you,
and now I have found you!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I have covered my couch with a bedspread,
with colored cloth made of Egyptian yarn.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I have perfumed my bed
    with myrrh, aloes, and cinnamon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Come, let’s drink our fill of love until morning.
Let’s enjoy making love.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Look, my husband isn’t home.
He has gone on a long trip.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He took a bag of silver with him.
He will not come home till the next full moon.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
She deceives him with enticing words.
With smooth lips she seduces him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He follows right after her,
like a steer going to slaughter,
like a deer prancing into a noose,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
until an arrow pierces its liver,
like a bird darting into a trap.
He does not realize this will cost him his life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Now, you sons, listen to me.
Pay attention to the words from my mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not let your heart turn in her direction.
Do not wander on her pathways,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
because she has brought down many victims.
Those she has killed are countless.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Her house is on the road to the grave.
It goes down to the chambers of death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do you hear Wisdom calling out?
Do you hear Understanding raising her voice?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
On the hills above the roads,
she takes her stand at the crossroads.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Beside the gates leading into the city,
at the entrance to the doorways, she cries out:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I call to you men,
and I raise my voice to the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You gullible people, get good judgment.
You fools, take this to heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Listen, because I am speaking noble thoughts.
I open my lips to speak upright things,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
for my mouth declares truth,
but wickedness is disgusting to my lips.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
All the words from my mouth are righteous.
There is nothing twisted or crooked in them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
All of them are clear to those who have understanding,
and they are upright to those who find knowledge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Accept my discipline instead of silver.
Accept knowledge rather than fine gold,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
because Wisdom is better than gems,
and anything you may desire cannot equal her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I, Wisdom, dwell with good judgment.
I discover knowledge and foresight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The fear of the Lord is to hate evil.
I hate haughtiness, arrogance, an evil way, and a perverse mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Good advice and sound judgment are mine.
I, Understanding, have strength.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
By me kings reign,
and rulers administer justice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
By me officials govern,
as well as nobles and all just judges.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I certainly love those who love me,
and those who eagerly look for me find me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Riches and honor are with me,
as well as enduring wealth and righteousness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My fruit is better than gold, better than pure gold,
and what I produce is better than fine silver.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I walk on the path of righteousness,
down the middle of the pathways of justice,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
so I can provide a rich inheritance to those who love me,
and I can fill their treasuries.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord possessed me at the beginning of his way,
before his works of long ago.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
From eternity I was appointed,
from the beginning, from before the origin of the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When there were no deep waters, I was brought forth,
when there were no springs filled with water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Before the mountains were settled in place,
before the hills, I was brought forth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
when he had not yet made land or fields
or the first dust of the world.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When he established the heavens, I was there.
When he drew the horizon around the surface of the deep,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
when he placed the clouds in the sky above,
when the fountains of the deep gushed out,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
when he established his decree for the sea,
so that the waters could not go beyond the limit set by his command,
when he marked out the foundations of the earth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I was beside him as a master craftsman.
I was his joy day after day.
I rejoiced in his presence at all times.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I rejoiced in his inhabited world.
I was delighted with the children of Adam.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So now, you children, listen to me,
because those who keep my ways are blessed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Listen to discipline and become wise.
Do not neglect it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How blessed is the person who listens to me,
so that he can watch at my doors day after day,
so that he can stand guard beside my front door,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
because whoever finds me finds life,
and he obtains favor from the Lord,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
but whoever sins against me harms himself.
All who hate me love death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Wisdom has built her house.
She has carved out her seven pillars.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
She has prepared her meat.
She has mixed her wine.
She has already set her table.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
She has sent out her servant girls.
She calls from the highest point in the city,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Whoever is naïve, let him turn in here.”
To someone who lacks sense she says,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Come, eat my food,
and drink the wine that I have mixed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Abandon your naïve ways and live.
Travel the road to understanding.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whoever corrects a mocker invites insults,
and whoever warns a wicked person invites abuse.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not warn a mocker, or he will hate you.
Warn a wise person, and he will love you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Give advice to a wise person, and he will become even wiser.
Teach a righteous person, and he will add to his learning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The fear of the Lord is the beginning of wisdom,
and the knowledge of the Holy One is understanding,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
because through me your days will be multiplied,
and years will be added to your life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If you are wise, you are wise to your own advantage.
But if you scoff, you alone will bear the consequences.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The woman Folly is boisterous.
She is deluded. She knows nothing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
She sits at the doorway of her house,
on a throne on the heights of the city,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
in order to call to those who pass by on the street,
those who are simply going along on their way,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Whoever is gullible, let him turn in here.”
To someone who lacks sense she says,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Stolen waters are sweet,
and food eaten in secret is delicious.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But he does not know that the souls of the dead are there,
that her guests are in the depths of hell.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The proverbs of Solomon.
A wise son brings joy to his father,
but a foolish son brings grief to his mother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Treasures gained by wickedness produce no profit,
but righteousness saves from death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord will not allow the righteous to starve,
but he frustrates the greed of the wicked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Lazy hands produce poverty,
but hardworking hands bring riches.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whoever gathers crops in summer is a sensible son.
Whoever sleeps at harvest time is a disgraceful son.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Blessings crown the head of a righteous person,
but violence covers the mouth of the wicked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
To remember a righteous person is a blessing,
but the name of the wicked will rot.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A wise heart accepts commands,
but a babbling fool will be ruined.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whoever walks with integrity walks safely,
but whoever follows crooked ways will be found out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whoever winks at evil causes trouble,
and a babbling fool will be ruined.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The mouth of a righteous person is a fountain of life,
but violence covers the mouth of the wicked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Hatred stirs up a quarrel,
but love covers all sins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Wisdom is found on the lips of a discerning person,
but a rod is appropriate for the back of one who lacks sense.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Wise people store up knowledge,
but the mouth of a stubborn fool brings ruin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A rich person’s wealth is his strong city.
Poverty is the ruin of poor people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The work of a righteous person leads to life.
The income of a wicked person leads to sin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whoever practices discipline is on the path to life,
but whoever rejects a warning goes astray.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whoever conceals hatred has lying lips,
and whoever spreads gossip is a fool.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When there are many words, sin never stops,
but a person who restrains his lips acts wisely.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The tongue of a righteous person is fine silver.
The heart of a wicked person has little value.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The lips of a righteous person shepherd many,
but stubborn fools die for lack of sense.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The blessing of the Lord makes a person wealthy,
and he adds no sorrow to it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Carrying out a wicked scheme is a game for the fool,
but wisdom gives pleasure to a person with understanding.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
What the wicked person dreads will come upon him,
but the Lord will grant what the righteous desire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When the storm has passed, the wicked person is no more,
but the righteous person has an everlasting foundation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Like vinegar to the teeth and like smoke to the eyes,
so is a lazy person to those who send him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The fear of the Lord will add days to a person’s life,
but the years of wicked people will be cut short.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The confident hope of the righteous is joy,
but the ambitions of the wicked will perish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The way of the Lord is a fortress for a person who has integrity,
but it brings destruction for evildoers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A righteous person will never be toppled,
but wicked people will not dwell on earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The mouth of a righteous person produces the fruit of wisdom,
but a perverse tongue will be cut off.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The lips of the righteous know what is acceptable,
but the mouth of the wicked produces depraved words.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Dishonest scales are disgusting to the Lord
but an accurate weight wins his approval.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When arrogance comes, shame follows,
but with humility comes wisdom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The integrity of the upright guides them,
but the dishonesty of the treacherous destroys them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Riches are of no help on the day of fury,
but righteousness saves from death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The righteousness of honest people makes their way smooth,
but because of his wickedness a wicked person falls.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The righteousness of upright people rescues them,
but treacherous people are trapped by their own desire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
At the death of a wicked man, his hope will perish,
and his confidence in his strength perishes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A righteous person is rescued from trouble,
and a wicked person takes his place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
With his mouth the godless person destroys his neighbor,
but righteous people are rescued by knowledge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When the righteous prosper, a city rejoices,
and when the wicked perish, there is a shout of joy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Through the blessing of upright citizens, a city is raised up,
but by the mouth of the wicked, it is torn down.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A person who lacks sense despises his neighbor,
but an understanding person keeps silent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A gossip goes around betraying secrets,
but a trustworthy spirit keeps a matter confidential.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Without guidance people fall,
but in many advisors there is safety.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Guaranteeing a loan for a stranger leads to trouble,
but one who hates to shake hands remains secure.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A gracious woman takes hold of honor,
but ruthless men take hold of riches.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A merciful man benefits his own soul,
but a cruel man brings trouble on his own flesh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A wicked person earns deceptive wages,
but one who sows righteousness reaps a true reward.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Just as righteousness leads to life,
pursuing evil leads to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Perverted hearts are disgusting to the Lord,
but his favor rests on those whose way has integrity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Be sure of this: An evil person will not go unpunished,
but the children of the righteous will escape.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The beauty of a woman who lacks moral judgment
    is like a gold ring in a pig’s snout.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The desire of the righteous leads only to good.
The hope of the wicked leads to fury.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
One person scatters his wealth, but it still increases.
Another hoards it unjustly, but this leads only to poverty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A person who spreads blessings will be enriched.
One who gives a refreshing drink will be refreshed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
People curse the person who hoards grain,
but a blessing rests on the head of one who sells it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whoever searches for good seeks favor,
but whoever pursues evil will find it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whoever trusts his wealth will fall,
but righteous people will flourish like green plants.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whoever troubles his household will inherit the wind,
and a stubborn fool will be a slave to a person with a wise heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The fruit of a righteous person is a tree of life,
and one who harvests souls is wise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If a righteous person is paid back on earth,
how much more a wicked person or a sinner!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A person who loves discipline loves knowledge,
but one who hates correction is stupid.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A good person will obtain favor from the Lord,
but he will condemn a schemer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A person cannot be made secure by wickedness,
but the roots of the righteous will never be uprooted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A wife with strong character is a crown to her husband,
but one who brings shame is like rot in his bones.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The plans of the righteous are just,
but the advice of the wicked is deceitful.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The words of the wicked lie in wait for blood,
but the mouths of the upright will save them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Wicked people are overthrown, and they are no more,
but the house of the righteous continues to stand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A person is praised for the good sense that he speaks,
but a person with a twisted heart will be despised.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Better to be underestimated and have a servant
than to pretend to be wealthy and lack bread.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A righteous person understands the needs of his livestock,
but the compassion of the wicked is cruel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A person who works his land will have enough food,
but whoever pursues fantasies lacks sense.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A wicked man covets the fortress of evil people,
but the root of the righteous bears fruit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The rebellion on his lips is a trap for an evil person,
but a righteous person gets out of trouble.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
From the fruit of his lips a person is filled with good,
and the labor of a person’s hands returns to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The way of a stubborn fool seems correct to him,
but whoever listens to advice is wise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A stubborn fool immediately lets his annoyance be known,
but a sensible person overlooks an insult.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whoever breathes the truth proclaims righteousness,
but a lying witness is deceitful.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Some people wield reckless words like the thrusts of a sword,
but the tongue of the wise brings healing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Truthful lips are established forever,
but a lying tongue lasts only a moment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Deceit lies in the heart of those who plot evil,
but for those who promote peace there will be joy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
No disaster will strike a righteous person,
but wicked people are filled with trouble.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Lying lips are disgusting to the Lord,
but those who act truthfully gain his favor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A man who is shrewd conceals his knowledge,
but the hearts of fools broadcast stupidity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Hardworking hands will rule,
but laziness results in forced labor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Anxiety in a person’s heart weighs him down,
but a good word brings him joy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A righteous person guides his neighbor,
but the way of the wicked leads them astray.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A lazy person does not roast his game,
but a diligent person uses his wealth wisely.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In the path of righteousness there is life,
and there is no death in following this path.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A wise son accepts his father’s discipline,
but a scornful son does not listen to a reprimand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
From the fruit of his mouth a person eats well,
but treacherous people have an appetite for violence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whoever guards his mouth preserves his life.
Whoever opens his lips carelessly ruins himself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The appetite of a lazy person craves things, but he gets nothing.
The appetite of hardworking people is fully satisfied.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A righteous person hates everything false,
but a wicked person causes disgrace and shame.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Righteousness guards a person who has integrity,
but wickedness perverts a sinner.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
One person pretends to be rich but has nothing.
Another pretends to be poor but has great wealth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A man’s riches may ransom his life,
but a poor man does not hear a threat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The light of the righteous brings joy,
but the lamp of the wicked will be put out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Insolence produces only strife,
but wisdom resides with those who take advice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Wealth gained out of thin air shrinks,
but wealth accumulated by steady work grows.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Hope delayed makes a heart sick,
but a desire fulfilled is a tree of life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The person who despises a word of instruction will pay the price,
but the person who respects a command will be rewarded.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The teaching of a wise person is a fountain of life.
It can turn someone away from the snares of death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Good sense yields grace,
but the way of the treacherous is unchanging.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Every sensible person acts with knowledge,
but a fool displays stupidity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A wicked messenger falls into trouble,
but a trustworthy envoy brings healing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A person who ignores discipline ends up with poverty and shame,
but one who conforms to correction will be honored.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A desire that is fulfilled tastes sweet to the soul,
but to fools it is disgusting to turn from evil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whoever walks with the wise becomes wise,
but a companion of fools suffers harm.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Trouble pursues sinners,
but goodness repays the righteous.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A good man leaves an inheritance to his children’s children,
but a sinner’s wealth is stored up for the righteous.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The farmland of the poor may produce much food,
but it may be swept away by injustice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A person who withholds his rod hates his son,
but one who loves him administers discipline promptly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A righteous person eats until his appetite is satisfied,
but the stomach of the wicked is always empty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A wise woman builds her house,
but a foolish one tears it down with her own hands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whoever walks in the right way fears the Lord,
but a person who is devious in his ways despises him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In the mouth of a stubborn fool there is a proud rod,
but the lips of the wise protect them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Without cattle the manger is empty,
but a great harvest is gained by the strength of an ox.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A faithful witness does not lie,
but a false witness breathes lies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A scoffer seeks wisdom yet finds none,
but knowledge comes easily to a discerning person.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Keep away from a foolish person,
since you will not learn anything from his lips.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The wisdom of a sensible person is that he understands his way,
but the stupidity of fools is deceptive.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Fools scoff at the idea of guilt,
but favor is found among the upright.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A heart knows its own bitterness,
and no stranger can share its joy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The house of the wicked will be destroyed,
but the tent of the upright will thrive.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
There is a way that seems right to a man,
but in the end it is the road to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Even in laughter a heart can ache,
and the end of joy may be grief.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A backslider will be satisfied with his ways,
and a good man will be satisfied with his.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A gullible person trusts anything,
but a sensible person considers his steps.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A wise person fears and turns from evil,
but a fool is rash and overconfident.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A short-tempered person acts foolishly,
and a schemer is hated.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Gullible people inherit stupidity,
but sensible people embrace knowledge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Evil people will bow down to good people,
and wicked people will bow at the gates of the righteous.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A poor person is hated even by his neighbor,
but those who love a rich person are many.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A person who despises his neighbor is sinning,
but one who is kind to the oppressed is blessed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Don’t those who plan evil go astray?
But those who plan to do good find mercy and truth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In all hard work there is gain,
but empty talk leads only to poverty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Their wealth is a crown for the wise,
but the stupidity of fools is just stupidity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A truthful witness saves lives,
but a liar breathes deceit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In the fear of the Lord a person gains strong confidence,
and his children will have a refuge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The fear of the Lord is a fountain of life.
It turns a person away from the snares of death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A large population brings glory to a king.
Without people a ruler is ruined.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A patient person has great understanding,
but an impatient person exalts foolishness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A contented heart gives life to the flesh,
but envy rots the bones.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A person who oppresses the poor insults his Maker,
but one who is gracious to the needy honors him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A wicked person is brought down by his own evil,
but a righteous person finds refuge even at his death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Wisdom rests in the heart of the discerning.
It can be recognized even among fools.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Righteousness lifts up a nation,
but sin brings shame to a people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A king favors a servant who acts wisely,
but he is furious with one who acts shamefully.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A gentle answer turns away wrath,
but a harsh word stirs up anger.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The tongue of the wise enhances knowledge,
but the mouths of fools spout stupidity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The eyes of the Lord are everywhere,
    watching evil people as well as the good.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A healing tongue is a tree of life,
but a perverse tongue shatters the spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A stubborn fool despises his father’s discipline,
but whoever heeds correction is sensible.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The house of the righteous contains great wealth,
but the income of the wicked brings trouble.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The lips of the wise spread knowledge,
but the heart of fools—not so.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A sacrifice of the wicked is an abomination to the Lord,
but a prayer of the upright gains his favor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The way of a wicked person is repulsive to the Lord,
but he loves those who pursue righteousness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Harsh discipline waits for anyone who leaves the path,
and a person who hates correction will die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Death and Destruction lie open before the Lord—
how much more human hearts!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A scoffer does not love anyone who corrects him.
He will not go to wise people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A joyful heart makes a cheerful face,
but a sorrowful heart crushes the spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The heart of a discerning person seeks knowledge,
but the mouths of fools feed on stupidity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
All the days of an oppressed person are evil,
but a cheerful heart enjoys a continuous celebration.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Better a little with the fear of the Lord
    than great wealth with turmoil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Better a meal of vegetables where there is love
    than a fattened calf with hatred.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A hothead stirs up a fight,
but a patient person calms a dispute.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The way of a lazy person is like a thorny hedge,
but the path of upright people is a highway.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A wise son brings joy to his father,
but a foolish person despises his mother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Stupidity delights a person who lacks sense,
but one who has understanding stays on course.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Plans fail without advice,
but where there are many advisors they succeed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Giving an apt response with his own mouth makes a person happy,
and a word at the right time—oh how good!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The path of life leads upward for a person with insight,
so that he may turn away from hell below.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord tears down the house of the arrogant,
but he maintains the property line of a widow.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The plans of the wicked are disgusting to the Lord,
but pleasant words are pure to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Someone who is greedy for gain brings trouble to his own household,
but a person who hates bribes will live.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The heart of a righteous person ponders his answer,
but the mouth of a wicked person gushes evil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord is far away from the wicked,
but he hears the prayer of the righteous.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A twinkle in the eyes delights the heart,
and good news gives health to the bones.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
An ear that listens to a life-giving warning
    will find a home among the wise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A person who ignores discipline despises himself,
but a person who listens to a warning acquires good sense.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The fear of the Lord gives discipline and wisdom,
and humility comes before honor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A person may have thought things through in his heart,
but an apt answer from his tongue comes from the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
All of a person’s ways are pure in his own eyes,
but the Lord weighs motives.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Commit what you do to the Lord,
and your plans will be established.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord has made everything for his own purpose,
even a wicked person for a day of trouble.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Anyone with an arrogant attitude is disgusting to the Lord.
Be sure of this: That person will not go unpunished.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Through mercy and truth, guilt is atoned for,
and through the fear of the Lord, one turns away from evil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When the Lord is pleased with a man’s ways,
he causes even his enemies to live at peace with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Better a little with righteousness
    than a large income without justice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A person’s heart plans his way,
but the Lord makes his steps secure.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The king’s lips speak for God,
so his mouth should not betray justice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
An accurate balance and scales belong to the Lord.
He has made all the weights in the bag.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It is disgusting for kings to commit wickedness,
because a throne is established by righteousness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Kings approve of righteous lips.
They love a person who speaks upright things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The king’s anger is a messenger of death,
but a wise person can appease it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
There is life in the light from a king’s face,
and his favor is like a cloud that brings spring rain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How much better to acquire wisdom rather than gold,
and to acquire understanding is more desirable than silver.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The highway followed by upright people turns away from evil.
The person who guards his way preserves his life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Pride goes before destruction,
and a haughty spirit precedes a fall.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Better to share a humble spirit with the oppressed
    than to share stolen goods with the haughty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whoever gives careful consideration to a matter will succeed,
and the person who trusts the Lord will be blessed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A wise heart will be called discerning,
and appealing speech increases learning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Good sense is a fountain of life for the person who possesses it,
but the instruction given by stubborn fools is stupidity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A wise heart produces edifying speech.
It makes a person’s lips more persuasive.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Pleasant speech is honey from a honeycomb,
sweet to the spirit and healing for the bones.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
There is a way that seems right to a man,
but it ends up being the road to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A laborer’s appetite labors for him,
because the hunger of his mouth drives him on.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A worthless scoundrel constantly plots evil,
and from his lips comes a scorching fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A perverse man spreads conflict,
and a gossip separates intimate friends.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A violent man entices his neighbor.
He leads him on a way that is not good.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A person who squints his eyes is plotting something perverse.
One who purses his lips has completed some evil plot.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Gray hair is a beautiful crown.
It is found on the way to righteousness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Better to be patient than to be a hero,
better to control your temper than to capture a city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Lots are cast into the pouch,
but the Lord determines all their decisions.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Better a piece of dry bread with peace
than a house full of feasting with quarreling.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A wise slave will rule over a shameful son.
He will share the inheritance with the brothers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
There is a crucible for refining silver and a smelter for gold.
In the same way the Lord examines hearts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
An evildoer pays attention to wicked lips.
A liar feeds upon a destructive tongue.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whoever mocks a poor person insults his Maker.
A person who rejoices over calamity will not escape.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Grandchildren are a crown for the elderly,
and parents are a source of pride for their children.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Eloquent lips are not fitting for a fool.
How much less lying lips for a ruler!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A bribe works like a charm for the person who gives it.
Wherever he turns, he prospers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A person who covers an offense pursues love,
but one who repeats the matter separates friends.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A reprimand impresses a discerning person
    more than receiving a hundred lashes impresses a fool.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
An evil person promotes only rebellion,
and a cruel messenger will be sent against him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Better to meet a bear robbed of her cubs
    than to meet a fool in his stupidity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A person who repays evil for good—
evil will never leave his house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Starting a quarrel is like opening a floodgate,
so stop the dispute before it gets started.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Acquitting a guilty person
and convicting an innocent person—
both of these are disgusting to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Why hand a fool money to buy wisdom,
since he has no aptitude for using it?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A friend loves at all times,
and a brother is born for a time of trouble.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A person without sense shakes hands
    to guarantee a loan for his neighbor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A person who loves sin loves conflict.
A person who builds his gate high invites destruction.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A crooked mind does not find good.
A perverted tongue will fall into disaster.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The man who fathers a fool has grief,
and the father of an arrogant fool will have no joy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A cheerful heart is good medicine,
but a crushed spirit dries up the bones.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A wicked person secretly accepts a bribe
to pervert the ways of justice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Wisdom is right in front of a discerning person,
but a fool’s eyes wander to the end of the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A foolish son is an aggravation to his father
and bitterness to the woman who bore him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It is not good to impose a fine on a righteous person
nor to flog officials because of their uprightness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A person with knowledge restrains his words.
A person with understanding is even-tempered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Even a stubborn fool who keeps silent will be considered wise.
He is considered to be perceptive if he keeps his lips shut.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A person who is a loner seeks his own desires.
He fights against all sound judgment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A fool finds no pleasure in understanding,
but only in revealing his own opinions.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When a wicked person comes, contempt comes with him,
and with dishonor comes disgrace.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The words from a man’s mouth are deep waters.
The fountain of wisdom is a flowing stream.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It is not good to show favoritism to a wicked person
    in order to deprive a righteous person of justice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A fool’s lips enter a fight,
and his mouth invites a beating.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A fool’s mouth is his destruction,
and his lips are a trap for his soul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The words of a gossip are like delicious food.
People gobble them right down.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A person who fails to do his work
    is a brother to a vandal.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The name of the Lord is a strong tower.
A righteous person runs inside and is protected.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A rich person’s wealth is his strong city.
In his imagination it is like a high wall.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Before destruction a man’s heart is proud,
but humility comes before honor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If a person answers before he listens,
that is foolishness that brings disgrace.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A man’s spirit can endure illness,
but who can bear a broken spirit?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A discerning heart acquires knowledge,
and the ears of the wise seek knowledge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A person’s gift opens doors for him.
It leads him into the presence of great people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The first person to state his case appears to be right.
Then his neighbor comes and cross-examines him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Casting lots ends disputes and decides between powerful people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A brother who has been wronged is harder to regain than a strong city,
and disputes are like a bar across the gate of a citadel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
From the fruit of a man’s mouth, his stomach is satisfied.
He is satisfied with the harvest of his lips.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Life and death lie in the power of a tongue,
and those who love to use it will eat its fruit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The man who finds a wife finds a good thing,
and he obtains favor from the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A poor man pleads for mercy,
but a rich man answers harshly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A man with many acquaintances may suffer harm,
but there is a loving friend who sticks closer than a brother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Better to be a poor person who walks in his integrity
than one with perverse lips who is a fool.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Zeal without knowledge is certainly not good,
and a person who acts hastily sins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A person’s own foolishness undermines his way,
but his heart rages against the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Wealth adds many friends,
but a poor person is deserted by his friend.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A false witness will not go unpunished.
He breathes lies and will not escape.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Many seek the goodwill of a ruler,
and everyone is a friend to a person who gives gifts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A poor person’s brothers all hate him.
Even his friends keep their distance from him!
Though he pursues them with words, they are not there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A person who acquires intelligence loves his life.
A person who guards understanding finds a good thing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A false witness will not go unpunished.
He breathes lies, and he will perish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A life of luxury is not appropriate for a fool.
How much less appropriate for a slave to rule over princes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Good sense makes a person slow to anger,
and it is to his credit when he overlooks an offense.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The king’s anger is like a lion’s growl,
but his favor is refreshing like dew on the grass.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A foolish son is a disaster to his father,
and a nagging wife is like constantly dripping water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Home and wealth are an inheritance from fathers,
but a wife with good sense is from the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Laziness makes a person fall into a deep sleep,
and an idle person will go hungry.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A person who keeps a command preserves his life.
One who despises his ways will die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A person who is gracious to the poor lends to the Lord.
He will repay him in full.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Discipline your son while there is hope.
Do not make yourself responsible for his death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Someone who has a lot of anger pays the penalty.
If you rescue him, you will have to do it again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Listen to advice and accept discipline,
so that you will be wise in the future.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
There are many plans in a man’s heart,
but it is the Lord’s purpose that will prevail.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A desirable trait in a person is loyalty.
It is better to be poor than a liar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The fear of the Lord leads to life.
One who has it rests content.
He will not be disturbed by trouble.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A lazy person buries his hand in the dish,
but he does not even bring the food up to his mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Strike a scoffer, and an undisciplined person may learn caution.
Warn a person with understanding, and he will gain knowledge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A son who attacks his father and chases away his mother
brings shame and disgrace.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If you stop listening to discipline, my son,
you will stray from the sayings that give knowledge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A malicious witness mocks justice,
and the mouth of the wicked swallows evil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Punishments have been prepared for scoffers
and beatings for the backs of fools.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Wine is a mocker, and beer is a brawler.
Whoever is intoxicated by them is not wise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The king’s rage is like a lion’s growl.
Whoever intrudes on him endangers his life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Avoiding strife brings honor to a man,
but every stubborn fool is always fighting.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A lazy person fails to plow when it is the season for planting.
He expects something in the harvest, but nothing will be there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The intentions in a person’s heart are deep water,
but a person with understanding can draw them out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Many people claim to be loyal,
but who can find a trustworthy man?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A righteous person walks in his integrity.
How blessed are his children after him!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When a king sits on his throne as judge,
he winnows out all evil with his eyes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who can say, “I have purified my heart.
I am cleansed from my sinfulness”?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Differing weights and differing measures—
both of them are disgusting to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Even a youth makes himself known by his acts,
by whether his conduct is pure and upright.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
An ear that hears and an eye that sees—
the Lord has made both of them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not love sleep, or you will become poor.
Keep your eyes open, and you will have enough to eat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“It’s no good! It’s no good!” says the buyer,
but then he goes away and brags.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
There is gold, and there are many gems,
but lips that have knowledge are a precious vessel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Take the garment from someone who guarantees a loan for a stranger.
Hold on to it when he offers it as collateral for a foreigner.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Food gained dishonestly tastes sweet to a person,
but afterward his mouth will be filled with gravel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Plans are strengthened by obtaining advice,
so do not wage war without consultation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A person who goes around spreading gossip reveals secrets,
so do not associate with anyone whose lips are always open.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The person who curses his father and his mother—
his lamp will be snuffed out in total darkness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
An inheritance easily obtained in the beginning
    will not be blessed in the end.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not say, “I’ll get even with you!”
Wait for the Lord, and he will rescue you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Differing weights are disgusting to the Lord,
and dishonest scales are not good.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The steps a man takes come from the Lord,
so how can anyone understand his own way?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A person falls into a trap if he pledges something to God impulsively
and considers his pledge only later.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A wise king winnows out the wicked.
He rolls the threshing wheel over them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A man’s spirit is the lamp of the Lord.
It illuminates the depths of his heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Mercy and truth protect a king,
and he maintains his throne with mercy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The splendor of young men is their strength,
but the majesty of old men is their gray hair.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Wounds and bruises scrub away evil,
and a beating scrubs the depths of the heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A king’s heart is like streams of water in the hand of the Lord.
He directs it wherever he desires.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In a person’s own eyes all his ways are right,
but the Lord weighs the motives of the heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Practicing righteousness and justice
    is more acceptable to the Lord than a sacrifice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Haughty eyes and an arrogant heart,
the unplowed field of the wicked, produce sin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The plans of a hard worker lead to abundance,
but everyone in a hurry rushes toward scarcity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Piling up treasure by a lying tongue
    is a vanishing vapor for those who seek death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The violence of the wicked will drag them away,
because they refuse to do what is just.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A guilty person’s way is very crooked,
but the conduct of a pure person is straight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Better to live on the corner of a roof
    than in a house shared with a nagging wife.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The soul of a wicked person craves evil.
He does not look on his neighbor with mercy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When a scoffer is punished, an undisciplined person becomes wise,
and when a wise person is instructed, he gains knowledge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Righteous One carefully watches the house of the wicked.
He throws the wicked down to ruin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whoever shuts his ear to the cries of the poor—
he too will cry out and not be answered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A gift given in secret soothes anger,
and a bribe slipped into the pocket soothes fury.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It is a joy for a righteous person to practice justice,
but destruction waits for those who practice evil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A person who wanders from the way of understanding
    will rest in the company of departed spirits.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whoever loves pleasure will be poor.
Whoever loves wine and olive oil will never be rich.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The wicked become a ransom for the righteous,
and the treacherous make a payment for the upright.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Better to live in an arid region
    than with a nagging, ill-tempered wife.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Good food and olive oil are stored up in the dwellings of the wise,
but a foolish person devours everything he has.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A person who pursues righteousness and mercy
    will find life, righteousness, and honor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A wise man can climb up to a city full of warriors
and pull down the strong defenses in which they trust.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The person who guards his mouth and his tongue
    guards himself from troubles.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The contemptuous, insolent person—“Scoffer” is his name—
    behaves with overflowing arrogance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A lazy person’s craving will kill him,
because his hands refuse to work.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
All day long he craves something more,
but a righteous person gives and does not hold back.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A sacrifice offered by wicked people is an abomination.
How much more when they bring it with evil intent!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A lying witness will perish,
but a man who listens will keep speaking forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A wicked person puts on a bold front,
but an upright person gives thought to his way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
There is no wisdom, no cleverness, and no advice
    that can stand up against the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A horse is made ready for a day of battle,
but the victory belongs to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A good name is worth more than great wealth.
Respect is worth more than silver and gold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Rich and poor have this in common:
The Lord is the maker of them all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A sensible person sees trouble and hides,
but the naïve keep going and pay the penalty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The outcome of humility and of the fear of the Lord
    is wealth, honor, and life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thorns and traps are on the road followed by the crooked.
Whoever guards his soul will stay far away from them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Dedicate a child to the way he should go,
and even when he becomes old, he will not turn away from it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A rich person rules over poor people,
and a borrower is a slave to a lender.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whoever sows injustice reaps trouble,
and the rod that inflicts his fury will be destroyed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A generous person will be blessed,
because he gives some of his food to the poor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Drive away a scoffer, and conflict leaves.
Quarrels and insults cease.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A person who loves a pure heart and whose lips are gracious
    will have a king as his friend.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The eyes of the Lord watch over knowledge.
He overturns the words of a treacherous person.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A lazy person says, “There’s a lion outside!
I’ll be murdered in the streets!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The mouth of an immoral woman is a deep pit.
The man who is under the Lord’s wrath will fall there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Foolishness is bound tightly to a child’s heart.
A rod of discipline will drive it far from him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whoever oppresses the poor to become great,
and whoever gives gifts to the rich—
both are sure to suffer loss.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
